snippet: After the House postponed any action, the Senate majority leader, Harry Reid, and Senator Mitch McConnell said that they had resumed talks on a deal to reopen the government and raise the debt limit.
abstract: House Republican leaders fail to find enough support for latest proposal to end shutdown and extend Treasury's borrowing authority as Fitch ratings agency warns that United States is on verge of costly ratings downgrade; Senate's Democratic and Republican leaders immediately resume talks on deal to reopen the government and raise the debt limit.

byline.contributor: Annie Lowrey and Ashley Parker contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: After the House postponed any action, the Senate majority leader, Harry Reid, and Senator Mitch McConnell said that they had resumed talks on a deal to reopen the government and raise the debt limit.

headline.sub:
Top Credit Agency
Says Standoff Could
Trigger Downgrade
headline.main: Senators Restart Talks as Default Looms
headline.print_headline: Talks In Disarray As House Balks Over Debt Plan
